question: At <katex>$27^{\circ}\text{C}$</katex> temperature, the mean kinetic energy of the atoms of an ideal gas is <katex>$E_1$</katex>. If the temperature is increased to <katex>$327^{\circ}\text{C}$</katex> then the mean kinetic energy of the atoms will be
explanation: Mean kinetic energy <katex>$E \propto T$</katex> (where T is absolute temperature).
